description:
Price: 30 euros
Maximun: 5 persons   There are no spots left !

 

Marco’s Bio:

Marco Lopriore is Italian born but raised in the Netherlands and lives in Belgium since more than 20 years. The kitchen in the Lopriore's family has always been the centre of the house where he spent most of his time and the centre of family life where any discussion starts and ends. Marco picked up the cooking passion from his dear mamma to prepare typical Italian dishes in the tradition of regional and Mediterranean cuisine.

Marco’s Harmony Remedy belief:

He strongly believes in balanced diets and healthy lifestyle because finally you are what you eat.

Marco’s menus:

1. pasta with zucchini
2. audergines/melanzane "Elisabetta way"
3. sicilian desert salad
4. chinotti drink

venue.name: Near Schuman Area.
venue.address_1: Address will be sent to participants

description: Some extract from the book" Take Time for Your Life " : Would you like to change your life? More time for yourself? Would you like to take better care of your health, reduce stress, and create more balance in your life? Well, you’re not alone. More and more people are tired of the fast-paced, frenzied ‘‘information age’’ and are interested in higher-quality lives — lives in which they have more time for themselves and their relationships, more energy to invest in their emotional, physical, and spiritual well-being. Let's meet take timet for ourselves to discuss about this subject.
name: Tea session in Grape vine Bar. Topic: Take time for your life !

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
After successfully hosting the first Chinese vegetarian cooking event, Chinese Chef Zhao with 25 cooking experiences would like to host the second Chinese vegetrain cooking event.

 

 

1. Vegetarian noodle salad  

 

Noodles are an essential ingredient and staple in Chinese cuisine. There is a great variety of Chinese noodles, which vary according to their region of production, ingredients, shape or width, and manner of preparation

 

 

 

2. Sichuan Style Eggplant

 

 Sichuan cooking is “One of the Four Great Traditions” of Chinese cuisine, now famous all over the world. Sichuan cuisine is said to be of “one dish, one shape, hundreds of dishes, hundreds of tastes”, describing how diverse the cuisine is. The most prominent traits of Sichuanese cuisine may be described with four words: spicy, hot, fresh and fragrant. This recipe may be made only with eggplant, vegetarian style.

 

 

3. Mixed vegetables in five colours (potato - yellow, Fungus - black, tofu -yellow white, mushroom - white , red and Green sweet peppers)

 

Scientists have found out that, the color of the vegetable is highly related with its nutrition. The vegetable with a dark color tend to has high nutritional value, and the light color indicates low nutritional value. The correct order is "green vegetables—red and yellow vegetables—colorless vegetable", with the nutritional value decreasing by the order.Each kind of vegetable contains different types and quantities of nutrients, but the nutritional need of human is multifaceted, so when you select the vegetables, besides paying attention to the color of the vegetable, you should also consider to mixing various kinds of vegetables together so as to provide sufficient and balanced nutrition to the body.

 

Rice + tea + juice

€ 40 per person (minimum 8 people and maximum 18 people)
name: Second Chinese vege cooking class:one of four great traditional sichuan style

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
A rich meal, shows a rich soul !

Ollie: Does healthy/real food taste different or better? Or is is just a habbit of taste fo ours ? Let us go one step beyond. Tasting is one thing but DO YOU feel more energetic with healthy food?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Energy is the one that keeps us active and provides the much needed power to complete our daily activities. Without energy, human beings are like cars without petrol, sailing ships without wind or fire without wood. Our main source of energy is food. This is why we have to plan our diet accordingly. Introducing high energy foods in our balanced diet will keep us active and highly productive during the entire day.
name: Tea session host by Ollie in Wilrijk. Topic: Energy in healthy food

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
« Tout le monde se sent écrasé par le rythme effréné de la vie d’aujourd’hui, selon Antoinette Giacobbe, psychothérapeute et mentor personnel. Mais miser sur la quantité plutôt que sur la qualité ne contribue sans doute pas à profiter de la vie au maximum. »

Antoinette aime bien citer Confucius : « La vie est simple, mais nous insistons pour la compliquer. » Et cette habitude peut causer des déséquilibres au foyer, au travail, dans les relations, et nuire à la santé du corps et de l’esprit. Pour ramener l’équilibre, il faut désencombrer sa vie et revoir ses stratégies — même celles qui sont inconscientes. « Une fois que vous aurez mis de l’ordre dans votre vie, explique Antoinette, vous pourrez la reprendre en main. »
name: Second Tea Session host by Philippe - Topic: Simplifier la vie !

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
Dear members,

If you are interested in joining, see you there !

Chères Amies,
Chers Amis,

J’ai le plaisir de vous inviter au vernissage d’un hommage inédit rendu à Victor VASARELY qui a marqué de son empreinte l’art du XXème siècle.

Il se tiendra le mercredi 16 octobre dès 18h30, au Musée d’Ixelles, Rue Jean Van Volsem 71, à Ixelles (entrée gratuite).

Cette exposition exceptionnelle qui se tiendra du 17 octobre 2013 au 19 janvier 2014, vous propose de redécouvrir le Vasarely peintre : aux cimaises seront exclusivement accrochés ses chefs d’œuvre de peinture.

Vasarely y développe son propre modèle d’art abstrait géométrique, en utilisant un nombre minimal de formes et de couleurs, devenant ainsi la figure clef de l’art cinétique ou « Op art ».

Réalisé en Collaboration avec la Fondation Vasarely, cet hommage fera grand bruit, et dans l’attente de vous y accueillir très nombreux, je vous prie de croire, Chères Amies, Chers Amis, à l’expression de mes sentiments amicaux.


Yves de JONGHE d’ARDOYE,
Député honoraire,
Echevin de la Culture.
name: VERNISSAGE VASARELY - MUSEE D'IXELLES - LE 16 OCTOBRE 2013

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
The meaning of life is a philosophical question concerning the significance of life or existence in general. It can also be expressed in different forms, such as "Why are we here?", "What is life all about?", "where do we come from ?"" where will we go ? "and "What is the purpose of existence?" It has been the subject of much philosophical, scientific, and theological speculation throughout history. There have been a large number of proposed answers to these questions from many different cultural and ideological backgrounds.

Let's share our thoughts on this topic with each other !
name: What is the meaning of life ? Tea session hosted by Yin !

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
Are you currently dealing with any hidden fears?
Did you discover something that needs to be dealt with?

Are you in touch with your fears, or have you hidden them in the dark recesses of your subconscious mind? We all harbor certain fears, and it can be an uncomfortable experience to pull them out into the open.

Does it bother you to talk about your fears? Do you ever feel like you are the only one with those feelings? Would you be willing to coax those fears out of hiding if there was a chance of getting rid of them once and for all?
name: Fears and how to deal with them ! Tea session hosted by Mario

description:
If you want to live a more fulfilled life, first you will want to know your potential, who you really are. Meditation is the route to that knowing. It is the methodology of the science of awareness. The beauty of the inner science is that it enables whoever wants to explore and to experiment within, to do so alone. This eliminates dependence on an outer authority, the need to be affiliated with any organization and the obligation to accept a certain ideology. Once you understand the steps, you walk the walk in your own, individual way.

Let's share our meditation experience this Sunday afternoon in Jun's tea session.
name: Meditation experience sharing. Tea session hosted by Jun

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
This afternoon's Harmony Remedy meetup will revolve around the general topic of "transformation". Transformation not meaning that you will have the capacity to transform iron ore into gold or that you will acquire the magic powers of a Superman or Batman by the end of the session. No, when we talk about transformation, it alludes to our capacity to take a difficult situation in our lives and to find the silver lining in it, so to speak. The hypothesis I'd like to put to discussion during this meetup is that there can always be something positive found in each and every situation. To illustrate and support us in the discussion we'll use a book which I've co-authored along with 16 other life coaches. We'll take a few short readings from selected chapters and these will then launch us into our open discussion (hopefully :=) At the end, you might go home feeling more convinced that there you're more powerful than before you arrived and that we are always free to change and transform things in our lives, and that a lot of the way we experience our life depends on our attitude and outlook.
At the end, you'll also have the possibility to buy the book at a reduced price (11.5€) compared to what you could get it by ordering on Amazon. Since I only have a small number of books currently available, If anyone is interested in buying the book, please let me know by email so I can put one aside for you (my email [masked]). Of course, there is no lack on Amazon, so you can always order it there too. If you want to get an advance look inside the book, you can check it out on Amazon by coping /pasting the whole of the following link into your browser: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/148953346X/ref=as_li_tf_il?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&creativeASIN=148953346X&linkCode=as2&tag=payopo-20

Mario Guerra
name: transformation session hosted by Mario Guerra

name: Do you follow your inner calling ?

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
The divine self that exists at an even higher level than your soul. It is the Divine essence of your being, the source of all light and life within you. Your soul is closer to your personality, and is an intermediary between you and your Divine Self until such time as you are able to directly experience and realize the Divine Self as who you are.

As you open to your Divine Self, you can receive its guidance, peace, harmony, and illuminating light. You can more easily turn away from the distractions of the physical world, and restore yourself in the light, love, and power of this eternal Self.


Through this Self, you can play in the world of all potential and manifest your highest path. This Self will reveal the illusions, desires, and attachments that keep you trapped in a lower vibration and on a lesser path. You gain a greater ability to recognize limiting, disharmonious, and restricting energies and forms. Not only will It reveal these limitations; contact with this Self will enable you to have the power, wisdom, and vision to release these energies.

Your Divine Self is always trying to reach you, to send you the power, illumination, love, and wisdom to draw higher forms, thoughts, feelings, and situations into your life. Your Divine Self is wise; it knows all, and is always showing you an easier, better, more joyful way to live.

Your Divine Self is always trying to reach you, to send you the illumination, love, and wisdom to live as your Divine Self.  You can open to all the gifts that it has for you by consciously making contact with it, opening to it, and asking for Its guidance and assistance. You need to make contact, to open up to, and to have the intention for this to occur. Remember that this Self is who you are, so you are opening to that greater part of yourself.
name: How to live on earth beyond human nature -  Contact Your Divine Self

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
Ayurveda Ayurveda is the holistic medicine used in India since recorded history (at least 6000 years), and there was already an oral tradition proving its existence long before.It is said Dhanvantari, the God of medicine, gave Ayurveda to mankind.One of the many branches of Ayurveda is ayurvedic cooking or how to adapt your nutrition, lifestyle, habits, environment, relationships … to your very own body-mind constitution.The use of spices and medicinal herbs is an important aspect in this approach.

Menu & program : 40€/person, We will learn together:


- how to eat vegetarian without deficiencies
- the importance of pure water and how to make it
- how to revert to a non-industrial food
- the secrets of spices - the reasons to go vegan
- the ayurvedic guidelines to digest well
- the concepts of AGNI (digestive fire) and AMA (toxins)
- the 6 RASA (tastes: sweet, salty, sour, pungent, astringent, bitter)
- the 3 MALA (excretions: urine, feces, perspiration)
- Dynacharia: ayurvedic ideal routine for the day

We will cook together: 


1. A DETOX TEA with many spices to drink throughout the day. Agni booster: ginger - salt- lemon: to kindle digestion

2. Complex Kitchari : spices, oil, cereal, legume and vegetables cooked together to improve digestibility. 


3. Masoor Dal : red lentils dal, traditional indian dish

4. Ayurvedic way of cooking a vegetable (carrots, green beans or snow pea)

5. Coriandre & Mint Chutney : refreshing and good to calm Pitta

6. Gomasio : salt replacement

7. Chapatis : the famous flat bread from India!
name: Ayurveda vegetarian cooking class

description:
Keep your heart free from hate, your mind from worry. Live simply. Except little. Give much. Scatter sunshine. Forget yourself and think of others. What's your way to happiness ? Please share with us your personal experiences and lessons learnt. Each person has 10 minutes to share their experiences, then 5 minutes Q&A sessions. 

You are welcome to join us.
name: The way to happiness - personal experiences and lessons learnt

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
Having clear boundaries is essential to a healthy, balanced lifestyle. A boundary is a personal property line that marks those things for which we are responsible. In other words, boundaries define who we are and who we are not. Boundaries impact all areas of our lives: Physical boundaries help us determine who may touch us and under what circumstances -- Mental boundaries give us the freedom to have our own thoughts and opinions -- Emotional boundaries help us to deal with our own emotions and disengage from the harmful, manipulative emotions of others -- Spiritual boundaries help us to distinguish God's will from our own and give us renewed awe for our Creator.

- Can I set limits and still be a loving person? - What are legitimate boundaries? - What if someone is upset or hurt by my boundaries? - How do I answer someone who wants my time, love, energy, or money? - Aren't boundaries selfish? - Why do I feel guilty or afraid when I consider setting boundaries?

venue.name: Tout Bon café - In front of ING bank in Place du luxembourg

name: Boundaries: When to Say Yes, How to Say No to Take Control of Your Life

description:
“What we call chaos is just patterns we haven’t recognized. What we call random is just patterns we can’t decipher.” ~Chuck Palahniuk

Why do we keep going through the same things in relationships? We are with different people, but things always end up being the same, or we act just like someone whom we used to know. Sometimes we feel that we get stuck in a vicious cycle of our own making, and we don’t even realize that we are basically chasing our tail, repeating the same situation over and over.

A good question to ask is: Are we reliving the same scene over and over again? What are the reasons behind? How to view the nature of the phenomenon? How can we make some changes? What is the first fundamental step to change?
name: Pattern in our relationship with others. Find your pattern and true self.

description:
Who you truly want to be, on the inside, is who you truly are. 

The things that you want, temporarily, seek to fulfill, sometimes fulfill, and if fulfilled, later regret, are the things that control you. You are not being free, by giving in to these temptations, wants, and desires, but instead your are being slave to these temptations, wants, and desires. You are the slave when you allow these things to control your thought, word, and deed. These things are distortions, and are not representative of true self. 

False Self

Desire to eat sweets and sugary foods 

Sexual thoughts 

Fear of flying 

Fear 

Timidity 

Fear 

Worrying 

Wanting to go back to sleep in the morning after getting up 

Grumpiness 

Selfishness 

Insecurity 

Anger 

Desire to fit in 

Tendency to conform 

Excessive drinking 

Excessive smoking 

Any behavior to excess 


True Self

Peace 

Clarity of mind 

Openness 

Emptiness 

Acceptance 

Humbleness 

Equilibrium 

Oneness 

False Self creates a warping, skewing, distorting image of True Self.
name: Removing all the layers to find your true self

group.name: The Belgium Harmony Remedy Meetup Group

description:
The Allegory of the Cave (also titled Analogy of the Cave, Plato's Cave or Parable of the Cave) is presented by the Greek philosopher Plato in his work The Republic (514a–520a).

The allegory may be related to Plato's Theory of Forms, according to which the "Forms" (or "Ideas"), and not the material world of change known to us through sensation, possess the highest and most fundamental kind of reality. Only knowledge of the Forms constitutes real knowledge. Socrates informs Glaucon that the most excellent must learn the greatest of all studies, which is to behold the Good. Those who have ascended to this highest level, however, must not remain there but must return to the cave and dwell with the prisoners, sharing in their labors and honors.
name: Topic discussion: Allegory of the Cave by Plato
